title: Rumored Nuptials
opening: Ingrid receives an unexpected proposal of marriage from a noble of rising status. As soon as Dorothea hears the name, she is adamantly against any engagement between them...

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: What's the matter, Ingrid? I never hear you sigh like that.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Oh, hi, Dorothea. And hello, Professor. Nothing's the matter. Well, nothing major.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: You don't look like it's nothing major. Then again, I suppose you always have a furrowed brow, don't you?

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Truth be told, there's rather a lot going on. It seems that there's always something to worry about...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What do you worry about?

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: A childhood friend who's always causing trouble, my family... Things like that.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's worrying you right now?

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Now? Oh, I really did not wish to bother you with such trivialities...

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: You see, I received a letter from my father recently.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: From Count Galatea? What a kind gentleman to have for a father.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: I thank you. But the content within the letter is what I find troubling.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Let me see! Oh, it's a marriage proposal... For you.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Do you know the suitor?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Have you ever met the suitor?

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: I've not met him, though I've heard his name here and there. He began life as a merchant but has somehow achieved rank in court. An enterprising noble from an allied territory. It's most likely that he wants the Crest of Daphnel that I bear to adorn his family name.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Hmm, yes, that sounds about right. The jerk.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: You sound as though you know him. Do you?

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Yes, I must admit that I know him. He tried to court me when I was a singer. Best advice I can give you, Ingrid? Stay far, far away from this guy.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: He's offered a sizeable dowry, so I must at least consider it–for the sake of my family.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Dowry? Ha! Blood money. That's all it is.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Dorothea, I–

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: This jerk's entire fortune is soaked in blood. Do you want to rebuild your own house using that kind of money? I mean, it's all just rumors, but I think it still might be worth investigating. What do you think, Professor? Should we go check this guy out?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's go.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Great. Let's tell the others.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: Uh, really? OK...

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We don't have time.

intro.speaker: Ingrid
intro.line: That's right, Dorothea. No point bothering. All of us, including the professor, are far too busy.

intro.speaker: Dorothea
intro.line: Are you sure? If you change your mind, Professor, just let me know.

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: Pft... The more we look into this guy, the more I see he's a monster, and no good for my Ingrid!

battle.speaker: Ingrid
battle.line: No kidding. There's no denying it. We'd better get back to the monastery.

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: Hold on a minute, you brats.

battle.speaker: Ingrid
battle.line: Surely you can't mean me. Wait... Did he send them?

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: This jerk figures he can grab Ingrid before things get too messy for him. Of course, we know the truth about him now, and he'll want to kill us and get rid of the evidence... But we'll never let him take Ingrid. Come on, let's hurry!

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: Protect Ingrid! Don't let anyone get near her!

battle.speaker: Merchant
battle.line: I'll increase the reward! Now hurry up and capture that girl!

battle.speaker: Ingrid
battle.line: That merchant is giving order to the bandits! I bet if we take him out, reinforcements will cease!

battle.speaker: Dorothea
battle.line: It's an ambush! Ingrid's in trouble!

battle.speaker: Ingrid
battle.line: Enemies in hiding...here? They are really getting on my last nerve!

battle.speaker: Rogue
battle.line: Ha! Gotcha! Your future husband is eagerly awaiting his bride, you know.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Finally! It's over. I'm sorry for causing such a mess.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Oh, hush. For you, I'd go through twice as much trouble. But are you all right? Did they hurt you?

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: I'm OK. Really. Thank you, Dorothea. My father will need to hear of this.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Ingrid! Welcome back. Did you speak with your father?

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: I did. I just returned to the monastery.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: What happened with the proposal?

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: As soon as I informed him of the suitor's unsavory tendencies, he rejected the proposal outright. Were we to form ties with such an individual, it would bode poorly for our family, regardless of the weighty dowry offered.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Oh, thank goodness! I'm so glad it all worked out.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: You and me both. My father also insisted I take this.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A Hero's Relic?

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Indeed. This is the magic lance, Lúin, which has been passed down for generations within my family. My father and siblings have no way of using it, since they bear no Crest. Father told me I should take it and use it to protect myself with. He said it's far better used protecting his daughter than gathering dust.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Aw, that's so sweet! Your father really does mean well, Ingrid.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: He's unendingly stubborn, but I am proud of who he is. Dorothea, Professor... I want to thank you.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: Of course.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: We couldn't just do nothing while you were facing a life of being married to a monster.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: It was important that we help you.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: It really was quite exciting too! So, you know, don't worry about it.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: I could never hand over my lovely Ingrid to some jerk who only wants her for her Crest.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Oh? Do I belong to you now, rather than to myself? Hey... Dorothea. This is probably more than a little awkward, considering where it came from, but...here.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: A ring? Is this... No! Is it?!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A proposal?

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Oh, Ingrid... I accept your offer! We'll be together forever!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: A bribe?

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: I mean, sure, I suppose... Clumsy bribe though, giving me a ring and not telling me why.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: Stop teasing me, Dorothea! I'm trying to be sincere. I wanted to find a way to emphasize how grateful I am to you. So I looked for something from among my things that I thought you would like. I mean...you may already have one like it, but I thought on the off chance you didn't...

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Ingrid, you are just adorable and I love it. But perhaps we should lend this ring to our teacher for now. Our dear teacher can best decide how to use it. You found hard enough. You've earned the right to have a little fun.

end.speaker: Ingrid
end.line: As you wish, Dorothea. I gave the ring to you, so you can do whatever you please with it.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Haha.
